lines.content: // Change this to your main class.
* Repopulates DukeTaskList with data retrieved from Duke.txt
* This method "saveData" is used to read data from DukeTaskList and write it to a StringBuilder
* Calls method "writeFile" to save the StringBuilder to Duke.txt
* @param taskList This is the first parameter to the saveData method
* @throws IOException exception thrown when there is an error reading or writing to Duke.txt
* This method "writeFile" is used to write a String to Duke.txt
* @param tasksToWrite This is the first parameter to the writeFile method
* @throws IOException exception thrown when there is an error reading or writing to Duke.txt
public void writeFile(String tasksToWrite) throws IOException{
* This method "readFile" is used to read data from Duke.txt
* Calls method refillTaskList to Repopulate savedTaskList with data from Duke.txt
* @throws IOException exception thrown when there is an error reading or writing to Duke.txt
* This method "refillTaskList" is used to identify the Task type of the string, create the corresponding object
* and repopulate savedTaskList with the created object
* @param line This is the first parameter to the refillTaskList method
Task t = new Deadline(taskDesc, formattedBy, taskIsDone);
Task t = new Event(taskDesc, taskAt, taskIsDone);
* This method "updateDukeTaskList" is used to clone objects from savedTaskList to DukeTaskList
* @return ArrayList<Task> This is the ArrayList of objects to be cloned to DukeTaskList
* Has constructor and methods for the Deadline object
* This constructor "Deadline" is used to construct the Deadline object when its created upon user input of "deadline xxx /by d/M/yyyy HHmm"
* @param description This is the first parameter to the Deadline constructor
* @param by This is the second parameter to the Deadline constructor
* This constructor "Deadline" is used to construct the Deadline object when its created when retrieving data from Duke.txt
* @param description This is the first parameter to the Deadline constructor
* @param by his is the second parameter to the Deadline constructor
* @param isDone This is the third parameter to the Deadline constructor
public Deadline(String description, LocalDateTime by, Boolean isDone) {
* This method "getBy" is used to get the due date of the object
* @return String This returns the due date of the object
* This method "toString" is used to return the relevant attributes to be printed
* @return String This returns the relevant attributes to be printed
* Takes in an input from the user and executes the command
* result is shown as the output on the console
* This Constructor "Duke" instantiates the necessary data structures on startup
* @throws IOException exception thrown when Duke cannot read saved Data in Duke.txt
* This method "run" is used to continuously scan for user input
* user input is passed into "Parser" to process the input to execute the corresponding action
Scanner myObj = new Scanner(System.in);  // Create a Scanner object
String userCmd = myObj.nextLine(); // Read user input
*This is the main method to run the Duke program
* @throws IOException exception thrown when Duke cannot read saved Data in Duke.txt
* @throws DukeException exception thrown specific to Duke
* @throws DateTimeParseException exception thrown when input date/time is not recognised
public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException, DukeException, DateTimeParseException{
* outputs custom exception messages specific to Duke
* Has constructor and methods for the Event object
* This constructor "Event" is used to construct the Event object when its created upon user input of "event xxx /at xxx"
* @param description This is the first parameter to the Event constructor
* @param at This is the second parameter to the Event constructor
* This constructor "Event" is used to construct the Event object when its created when retrieving data from Duke.txt
* @param description This is the first parameter to the Event constructor
* @param at his is the second parameter to the Event constructor
* @param isDone This is the third parameter to the Event constructor
public Event(String description, String at, Boolean isDone) {
* This method "getAt" is used to get the details of the event appointment
* @return String This returns the details of the event appointment
* This method "toString" is used to return the relevant attributes to be printed
* @return String This returns the relevant attributes to be printed
* Handles user input and executes the corresponding command
* This Constructor "Parser" instantiates the necessary variables to be used in Class "Parser"
* @param save This is the first parameter to the Parser Constructor
* @param taskList This is the second parameter to the Parser Constructor
* This method "parse" is used to execute the correct command based on user input
* @param userCmd This is the first parameter to the parse method
throw new DukeException("Done index out of range");
throw new DukeException("Delete index out of range");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS!!! The description of a deadline cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS!!! The description of a event cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS!!! The description of a find cannot be empty.");
throw new DukeException(" OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
System.out.println("Input of /by has to be in \"dd/MM/yyyy HHmm\" format e.g \"14/03/1997 1159\"");
* This method "getExitStatus" is used to end the Duke Program
* @return boolean This is the exit status of the Duke program
* Has constructor and methods for the Task object
* This constructor "Task" is used to instantiate the attributes of the Task Object
* @param description This is the first parameter to the Task constructor
* This method "getStatusIcon" is used to get the tick or cross icon based on if the task is done or not
* This method "getTaskType" is used to get the taskType of the Task object
* This method "getDescription" is used to get the description of the Task object
* This method "markAsDone" is used to mark the Task as done upon completion of the task
* changes the isDone attribute to true
* contains the TaskList for Duke as well as the constructors and methods for TaskList
* Has constructor and methods for the ToDo object
* This constructor "ToDo" is used to construct the ToDo object when its created upon user input of "todo xxx"
* @param description This is the first parameter to the ToDo constructor
* This constructor "ToDo" is used to construct the ToDo object when its created when retrieving data from Duke.txt
* @param description This is the first parameter to the ToDo constructor
* @param isDone This is the second parameter to the ToDo constructor
* This method "toString" is used to return the relevant attributes to be printed
* @return String This returns the relevant attributes to be printed
* Outputs messages to the console after command is executed
System.out.println("\tBye. Hope to see you again soon!");
System.out.println("\tWhat can I do for you?");
System.out.println("\tNice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println("\tGot it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("\tNow you have " + taskList.getTaskList().size() +" tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("\tHere are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("\tHere are the matching tasks in your list:");
